label: 自力
本: Sand and Pebbles: The Tales of Mujû Ichien, A Voice for Pluralism in Kamakura Buddhism . State University of New York Press . 1985
説明文: Attaining enlightenment through one's own efforts, in contrast to reliance on the Other Power (tariki, q. v.) of Amida's Original Vow (hongan, q. v.). The Kamakura Amidist movements frequently criticized, for example, the traditional requirement to raise the desire for enlightenment" (hotsubodaishin, q. v.) taught by the followers of the Holy Path (shōdō: Tendai, Shingon, Kegon, Zen, etc.) as a useless assertion of egotism during the period of the Latter Days (mappō, q. v.) [他力、本願、發菩提心、聖道、天台、真言、華厳、禅、末法]"
